name: Avado
description: After starting out as a fork of Dappnode in 2018, AVADO has since advanced in its own right and gone all-in on streamlining the “run your own node” process for Ethereum PoS and other blockchains. Avado only sell hardware and do not offer their software standalone.

name: DAppNode
description:
With Dappnode, anyone can run decentralized networks like Ethereum and earn rewards. Dappnode takes care of the technical stuff so anyone can play a role in creating an open, equitable internet and access the rewards that are offered in return.

With Dappnode, anyone can run decentralized networks like Ethereum and earn rewards. Dappnode takes care of the technical stuff so anyone can play a role in creating an open, equitable internet and access the rewards that are offered in return.

name: Ethereum on ARM
description: Ethereum on ARM provides PnP images for ARM64 boards such as Rock 5B and Orange Pi 5 plus that turns the devices into Full Ethereum / Staking nodes making it easier for regular users to run Ethereum at home.

name: EthDocker
description:
eth-docker aims to make running an Ethereum staking full node simpler than setting everything up manually, while allowing the user choice when it comes to the exact client mix they wish to run.

It's the "easy button" for home stakers, with full control for advanced users.

name: Stereum
description:
Decentralization with ease: Stereum - your one-stop tool for Ethereum Node installation, setup, and management!

Stereum is a toolkit to simplify the process of setting up and maintaining an Ethereum Node. Developed over the last years out of a simple docker compose setup, released before even the beacon chain went to the mainnet, our efforts focus on helping to decentralize the Ethereum network even further by lessening the technical entry barrier for the average person to stake their own coins using their machines, as well as the possibility to run different node-related protocols.

Stereum's Ethereum Node Installation, Setup & Management tool aims to be the most flexible way to leverage your node for ETH staking, data science, dApp hosting & development!

name: Launchnodes
description:
Launchnodes acts as an orchestration layer enabling enterprises and individuals to solo stake Ethereum on public cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure) and bare metal. 

Products and services include: Prysm and Teku validator nodes, pre-synced beacon nodes and RPC, beacon node connection, white label staking solutions, impact staking.

name: Allnodes
description: Allnodes is a leading platform, which provides reliable non-custodial nodes hosting and staking services.

name: BloxStaking
description:
BloxStaking is a fully non-custodial staking solution that allows the user to retain both the validator key and withdrawal key. Utilizing a highly secure HashiCorp plugin (KeyVault).

BloxStaking never has access to your validator key or any sensitive information.

name: Kiln
description: Kiln is the leading enterprise-grade staking platform, enabling institutional customers to stake programmatically their digital assets, and to whitelabel staking functionality into their offering. Our platform is API-first and enables fully automated validators, rewards, data and commission management.

name: RockX (Node)
description:
RockX is a global blockchain node network and gateway for users to seamlessly access Web3, offering institutional-grade solutions and a full suite of developer tools for users to stake and build on all major Proof-of-Stake blockchains. 

With its foundations rooted in staking, protocol research and infrastructure design, RockX has built countless access nodes for users to interact with over 20 layer 1 and 2 protocols — driving greater accessibility and furthering adoption of blockchain technologies.

With over 20 major tokens available and over USD 1 billion staked in cumulative token value since 2018, RockX is one of Asia’s leading staking platforms, offering institutional clients new ways to do more with their crypto.

name: Rocket Pool (Node)
description:
Rocket Pool is the base layer protocol for decentralised and trustless Ethereum staking.

Designed to support stakers of all shapes and sizes, Rocket Pool was built with the intent to allow anyone to permissionlessly stake ETH to a network of decentralised node operators with full autonomy underpinned by RPL token collateral.

The core premise behind a protocol is to ensure the network is not beholden to any one party. This is a principle directly linked to Ethereum itself, and a mindset used at every stage of the process as we continue to upgrade the protocol.

Rocket Pool strives to embody the core ethos of Ethereum and DeFi, specifically the non-custodial, trustless nature that allows self-sovereignty to truly thrive.

name: Everstake
description:
Everstake is a responsible validator trusted by 625k+ users across 70+ blockchain networks. Created by engineers for the entire community in 2018.

Everstake 0.1+ ETH staking solution works as a set of pools where separate delegations are put together in order to collect 32 ETH required to launch a validator, as required by the rules of the Ethereum protocol.

Everstake lifetime APR for Ethereum staking of ~7% is the highest among top-tier validators, which makes the 0.1+ ETH staking solution from Everstake the most high-yielding staking service available for wider audiences. In addition, Everstake’s solution is non-custodial, meaning that the user retains complete control over their ETH. 

Everstake boasts zero slashing events recorded on the Ethereum network, near-100% uptime, and over 10k ETH validators running, making it one of the most reliable validator choices.

name: Rocket Pool (LST)
description:
Rocket Pool is the base layer protocol for decentralised and trustless Ethereum staking.

Designed to support stakers of all shapes and sizes, Rocket Pool was built with the intent to allow anyone to permissionlessly stake ETH to a network of decentralised node operators with full autonomy underpinned by RPL token collateral.

The core premise behind a protocol is to ensure the network is not beholden to any one party. This is a principle directly linked to Ethereum itself, and a mindset used at every stage of the process as we continue to upgrade the protocol.

Rocket Pool strives to embody the core ethos of Ethereum and DeFi, specifically the non-custodial, trustless nature that allows self-sovereignty to truly thrive.

name: Bedrock by RockX (LST)
description: Bedrock is RockX’s proprietary liquid staking solution designed with the specific needs of institutions and high net worth individuals in mind. Built on the pillars of transparency, decentralisation, security, and compliance, Bedrock presents a liquid staking protocol of the highest standard, with the goal of bridging DeFi and CeFi seamlessly.

name: ether.fi (LST)
description: The first natively restaked liquid staking token. Stakers keep their keys. The protocol is decentralized and non-custodial.

name: Diva Staking (LST)
description:
Diva is an Ethereum Liquid Staking protocol powered by Distributed Validator Technology (DVT).

It extends Ethereums Proof of Stake providing new functionality for Stakers and Operators:

- Liquid Stakers receive divETH, a Liquid Staking Token which accrues Ethereum Staking Rewards.
- Operators run a Distributed Validation node to fulfill staking duties and earn additional Operator Rewards.

divETH is a receipt token and its balance updates daily to reflect the deposited ETH balance plus its accrued Ethereum staking rewards.

While other solutions have some of these features, Diva is the first solution that fully integrates Liquid Staking with Distributed Validation, offering both Liquid Stakers and Operators the most efficient functionality.

**Liquid Staking**

🌱 No minimum ETH to stake.
👏 No requirement to run a node.
💧 Liquid Staking Tokens without lockups.

**More Resilient Operations**

🌳 Resilient: Nodes are fully disposable.
❤️‍🔥 Self-healing: Ability to regenerate lost keys.
💠 Redundancy: ~500x better uptime thanks to DVT fallbacks.

**Incentives and Penalties**

📈 Smooth Staking Rewards.
⛔️ Quick ejection of bad actors.

name: Swell
description: A non-custodial ETH liquid staking protocol that helps you optimize yield in DeFi.

name: Lido
description:
Lido is the name of a family of open-source peer-to-system software tools deployed and functioning on Ethereum.

Users mint transferable utility tokens, which receive rewards linked to the related validation activities of writing data to the blockchain, while the tokens can be used in other on-chain activities.

name: eth-wizard
description: An Ethereum validator installation wizard meant to guide anyone through the different steps to become a fully functional validator on the Ethereum network. It will install and configure all the software needed to become a validator. It will test your installation. It will help you avoid the common pitfalls. It will help you maintain and keep your setup updated.

name: ETH+
description:
A reward-generating Ethereum Liquid Staking Token basket with over-collateralized protection.

ETH+ Mandate

1: Maintain an Ethereum-aligned Liquid Staking Token basket.

2: Positively impact the Ethereum staking distribution.

3: Provide value to ETH+ holders through diversification.

name: Nethermind Sedge
description:
Sedge is a one-click node setup tool for PoS network/chain validators and nodes written entirely in the Go programming language.

Sedge takes care of the entire on-premise full node setup based on the chosen client, using generated docker-compose scripts based on the desired configuration.

name: Stader (Node)
description:
Stader empowers node operators to decentralize ETH staking.

Stader has lowered the entry barrier for permissionless validators to an industry-low bond: 4 ETH + 0.4 ETH worth of SD as collateral.

name: Stader (LST)
description:
Stader ETHx is built upon 3 main principles: decentralization, scalability and security. 

Its multipool architecture ensures scalability with a set of permissioned NOs, while it also powers decentralization allowing anyone to run a permissionless validator with an industry low capital barrier of 4.4 ETH.

Audited by Sigma Prime, Halborn and Code4rena, and also 1M$ Immunefi Bug Bounty.

name: Stakehouse
description: The Stakehouse protocol is tooling around the Ethereum Deposit Contract (EDC) which enables stakers to have fungible staking derivatives without compromising the unique yield of each ETH thus upholding the atomic dependency of a single ETH validator. Stakers now have increased optionality when it comes to staking. Solo stakers can now access a true derivative that is not based on a pool and take control of their own ETH. Users maintain full autonomy by having the ability to select any node operator they would like. The Stakehouse protocol will provide staking and validator rewards at mass.

name: Blockdaemon
description:
Why Choose Blockdaemon Stake?
Stake is safe, reliable and backed by 100% slashing insurance guarantee. Blockdaemon is the choice for major financial institutions and has helped leading crypto and TradFi companies deploy $1+ billion worth of staking infrastructure to date.

name: Serenita
description:
At Serenita, we understand the complexities involved in efficiently managing digital assets, particularly when it comes to Ethereum. Our team of seasoned professionals possesses a wealth of knowledge and experience in the field of blockchain technology, managing infrastructure and cybersecurity.

We leverage this expertise to offer a suite of reliable and secure services designed to optimize returns on digital assets.

name: Twinstake
description: Twinstake is an institutional-grade, non-custodial staking provider designed and built in collaboration with leaders in the digital assets space.

name: ssv.network
description:
ssv.network is a fully decentralized, open-source ETH staking network based on Secret Shared Validator (SSV) technology.

SSV is also known as DVT, or Distributed Validator Technology, as it provides an open and simple infrastructure for splitting and distributing a validator key into multiple Key-Shares, for the purpose of running an Ethereum validator across multiple non-trusting nodes.

Running an Ethereum validator on ssv.network achieves active-active redundancy, introduces new levels of validator key security, and benefits the Ethereum network, staking pools, staking services, and solo stakers.

name: StakePark
description:
StakePark is an independent, staking pool alternative for the good of the Ethereum mainnet.

- Capped 🚫 total # of validators

- Minority🌈client software

- Alternative⚡hosting infra

name: Bake
description: Bake is the retail arm of Cake Group, one of the fastest growing digital assets innovators. Bake is a one-stop platform that provides easy access to decentralized finance (DeFi) services and applications, empowering customers to generate returns on their cryptocurrencies in a secure and transparent way.

name: XHash
description:
XHash specializes in non-custodial staking services which are Secure, Easy and Audited.
We are dedicated to forging the foundation of Web3.0 with stable, reliable, and secure blockchain infrastructure to empower your journey in the decentralized world.

name: Consensys
description:
Consensys offers a complete suite of products to create and participate in web3, including MetaMask, Infura, Linea, Consensys Staking and more.

Consensys Staking is a leading institutional grade Ethereum staking platform, enabling customers to stake programmatically their digital assets and build white label staking applications.

name: DxPool
description:
DxPool is your trusted destination for cryptocurrency staking, offering a professional and user-friendly platform to enhance your staking experience. In a world where blockchain complexities can be overwhelming, DxPool simplifies the process, empowering you to maximize rewards while minimizing technical challenges.
This is our deposit contract address: 0x1a0fFC5d6a8F14bAcfb21056355394128fA6B955
One of our Public Key: 0x8088385ccc4ce1aecd627363f7099cd73a657ed60041922b8a26cbd65baa74b1df04ec438b649d270adedda90278891b

name: Puffer Finance
description:
Puffer is the first native liquid restaking protocol built on Eigenlayer. Puffer is much more than just a staking pool; it's a protocol that works to fortify Ethereum's heart.

At its core, Ethereum's security and credible neutrality relies on a vast network of nodes. We're on a mission to ensure a thriving decentralized pocket amidst the broader validator set, making home-staking not just feasible but extraordinarily viable!
